1123279002616025088.text:
FB is launching Portal, it’s in-home Video device, internationally. It’s coming to Canada in June and Europe later this fall. 

Prediction: European regulators are going to LOVE the idea of a FB camera coming to people’s living rooms!

1123338911152050177.text:
Google refers to its executives and board members by their first names in its annual proxy statement. 

Is this unusual? I feel like it is.pic.twitter.com/PWjdhPwoKi

1123279539600351234.text: This was the nerd version of Oprah's "and YOU get a car, and YOU get a car" moment.https://twitter.com/jackiehluo/status/1123279338890190848 …

1123255905217327104.text:
Got it? Google vs everything else is the segment disclosure that matters. 

(Counter-point: YouTube has its own CEO.)pic.twitter.com/qhbh7MrFVU

1123257762534887424.text:
Just a reminder that Amazon may not divulge its own financial secrets willingly. 

It disclosed subscription revenue from Prime etc after a similar comment letter from the SEC.

The SEC also asked repeatedly about Kindle sales, Echo sales and AWS. Eventually we got the latter.

1123312854961139714.text: New colleague @KurtWagner8 is wearing a very Facebook on-brand blue sweater today for F8 television hits today, which shows you he's already better at being a Bloomberg employee than the rest of us.pic.twitter.com/X2cUF28jWi

1123256920377319426.text:
There was months of back and forth with the SEC over this and other issues -- but mostly about segment disclosure. 

Seriously, I read quite a few comment letters and these were something else. I'm talking multiple flow charts. 

Ultimately, the SEC dropped the matter.pic.twitter.com/6lPHGPKTgG

1123348203917795328.text:

The real thing has been nuked by the WSJ archives, i think.https://appleinsider.com/articles/10/06/02/jobs_apple_tv_a_hobby_because_theres_no_market …

1123258261153693697.text: In short, I appreciate you, people toiling in the (I imagine) basement of the SEC reading corporate filings and nagging giant companies for better disclosure.

1123255241317679110.text: Google's answer? It believed separating out advertising revenue and Google websites/network websites are the best segment disclosures. Respectfully disagree. https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1652044/000165204417000031/filename1.htm …pic.twitter.com/xhd6ciuHPl

1123199369501655042.text: Anyway, Alphabet's market cap looks to open about $57 billion lower this morning. Or as @levynews measured it yesterday, two-thirds of an Uber in market cap.
